name: WPC Show Single Variations for WooCommerce
author: WPClever

sections.description:
WPC Show Single Variations is a nice plugin for presenting variations of variable products as single items on catalog pages. Variations will appear on the catalogs (shop, category page, tag & search results) as normal simple items, but still, stay within the variable parent products. Users can adjust the display at ease by enabling/disabling the functionality on the system basis or reversing it on the variation basis from the Variations tab.

This type of display creates an abundant & straightforward appearance of items in your store and assists customers in searching for the right choice with fewer clicks. It is indeed a great & easy-to-use tool to organize your online store to attain better convenience & performance.

Features

  • Enable/disable on the whole site
  • Enable/disable/reverse the functionalities for individual variations
  • Display/hide the parent variable products
  • Exclude some variable products from being hidden
  • Tool to manually generate the variations for the category/tag page
  • Show variations as simple items with an Add to Cart button on the catalog
  • Can be treated as single products by WPC Smart Quick View, Smart Wishlist & Smart Compare

Wanna save your precious time working on variations? Try our brand-new free plugin WPC Variation Bulk Editor and WPC Variation Duplicator.

Not what you needed?

sections.installation:
1. Please make sure that you installed WooCommerce
  2. Go to plugins in your dashboard and select “Add New”
  3. Search for “WPC Show Single Variations”, Install & Activate it
  4. Go to WPClever > Show Single Variations to enable/disable for the whole site
  5. Go to each variation to enable/disable/reverse for the individual variation

sections.reviews:
Great

By Moin Munna (moinmunna) on March 13, 2023

Fulfills the purpose

Not performing correctly.

By martini0 on July 5, 2022

Not performing correctly.

Working with Variation But not working with Attribute Filter

By Microwebs Bangladesh (microwebsbangladesh) on January 6, 2022

When we installed this plugin we assumed that its working fine. Variable to single products showing is ok but Filter not working Properly. It should be solved nevertheless its worthless to us

Nice plugin & support

By m_disseny on May 4, 2021

The plugin works nicely and does what it promises with a simple set up. The only weak point is the "re-init variations" function that should be run in background to prevent server time outs on larger stores with lots of variations. Otherwise it is a great free plugin.

Breaks Category Pages

By upcodestudios on March 18, 2021

When this plugin is activated, it works great on the shop page but it breaks all the category pages. For every category page it says "No products were found matching your selection"

Sweet Plugin and it works

By Wildcard (TheNewGuy_14) on November 10, 2020

Very nice easy plugin to show all variations of a product on your shop page. But I wish there was an option to turn it off on certain products. I can't seem to find any option for this

Im loving it, simple and superb

By haves86 on September 13, 2020

Very good plugin and not very commonly available in WP :-)

It works but not totally

By tivo45 on August 23, 2020

This plugin does the job but not well enough to my opinion. I came across a few bugs and quirks like : - The number of generated items does not match category count product (you'll need to disable category count to keep navigation consistent) - It generates invisible items for products that are not published yet (draft, import list, etc ...) which results in a few empty pages. It would be a great feature to be able to choose the attribute we want the plugin to use for splitting variations. Instead, it splits according to all the attributes. (ex: it splits by color but also by size)

This is pretty good and works well.

By Shaolin on August 14, 2020

This was pretty good - most importantly unlike others (even premium ones) it has global settings. Pretty much set and forget. I don't know how it would work if you had multiple attributes (I basically only have colours) but it did what I needed. However I decided against using it because the Minimum/Maximum quanties plugin I use (and which is essential) no longer works properly in Yiths Quick View. Normally if the parent product is set for a minimum quantity even if the variations haven't set a quantity it will take from it's global settings and all appears right. However with this plugin the variations always showed the default minimum (1) even if a minimum (2) was actually input for the variation. I have 3 different min/max plugins which I use at various times and they all did the same thing on the Quick View (going to the product itself the quantity was correct) so I suspect the conflict is probably with Quick View. I could try a different Quick View I suppose, but don't have the time. Quick View worked properly again when the plugin was deactivated (presumably because it was taking the quantity from the parent and the variations were back to swatches) Nevertheless, this is a very promising plugin and I hope to use it in the future.

Great for simple products

By realweezel on August 13, 2020

The plugin works great with simple products. But digging deeper, there are some problems. 1. If you have Multi-Level Variations (like Fashion: Color & Size) it will show all the variations. Would be nicer to only show the color-variation instead of color-size. There is no setting / mapping to do so. 2. If you re-init the products, it will always end in a critical error. But the job seems to run properly. 3. If variations are shown in the product list, only the title will be linked, not the image. Which is, especialy on mobile, not very userfriendly. Also the theme-owned "badges" and the bullet-points are not shown in the list as with "regular products". Still a great plugin for many sites I guess.
